snippet: If researchers prove the Assad regime is closely tied to the Syrian Electronic Army, foreign governments may choose to respond, because the attacks have real-world consequences.
abstract: Hacking group that calls itself the Syrian Electronic Army strikes again, breaking into Twitter accounts and blog headlines of The Financial Times; attack was part of crusade that targeted dozens of media outlets; governments may choose to respond to mysterious attacks, as they might have close ties to regime of Pres Bashar al-Assad and have real-world consequences.
lead_paragraph: If researchers prove the Assad regime is closely tied to the Syrian Electronic Army, foreign governments may choose to respond, because the attacks have real-world consequences.

headline.seo: Hunting for Syrian Hackers’ Chain of Command
headline.main: Hunting for Syrian Hackers’ Chain of Command
headline.print_headline: Hunting for Syrian Hackers’ Chain of Command
